messages.text: update this to use preact to prerender to a string, then pass the string in to puppeteer and have it use the string as the html it's using

Okay, I can help with that. I'll update the Puppeteer test to use Preact's `renderToString` to generate the HTML content and then use `page.setContent` to load it in Puppeteer.

First, I need to read the file to make sure I have the correct context.

Okay, I have the content of `src/PaperCrane.puppeteer.js`. Now I will modify the test to use Preact for prerendering and `page.setContent` in Puppeteer. I'll also add the necessary imports for `puppeteer`, `renderToString`, `html`, and the `PaperCrane` component.

I've updated the test in `src/PaperCrane.puppeteer.js` as requested. It now uses Preact's `renderToString` to generate the HTML content and Puppeteer's `page.setContent` to load it for the test. I also added the necessary imports.
